In this session we will be discussing from the 26th verse of the 8th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Continuing the prayers by Queen Kunti.
The meaning of this verse is
One who is on the path of material progress, trying to improve himself with respectable parentage, great opulence, high education, and bodily beauty, cannot approach you with sincere feeling.
So Kunti Devi is right.
Revealing a secret about the way to approach Krishna.
The simple ways to call out Krishna's name and in this way directly come in contact with Krishna, approach Krishna.
But there is a quality to such utterance of the name or calling out the name.
So she is telling here.
One can approach with sincere feeling if they are materially exhausted.
If they are puffed up with material opulence, then they cannot sincerely call out the Lord's name.
And Prabhupada elaborately explains that in the purport.
So Srila Prabhupada says,
Being materially advanced means,
Taking birth in an aristocratic family and possessing great wealth, Janma, Aishwarya, and education, Shruta, and attractive personal beauty, Shri, Janma, Aishwarya, Shruta, Shri.
These four are described here.
All materialistic men are mad after possessing all these material opulences.
And this is known.
As the advancement of material civilization.
The whole world practically is in ignorance about the spiritual truths, spiritual reality.
And therefore, people are mad after material opulence.
But the result is that by possessing all these material assets, one becomes artificially puffed up.
We are being intoxicated by such temporary possessions.
Why is it said artificially puffed up?
Because there is no real asset to be proud of.
It is simply some illusory possession that people become proud of.
